Hurry up and choose a hero to go down to the dungeon and be the first to retrieve the precious crystal!

—description from the publisher

Name: Guerrillas of the Peninsular War
Description:
Guerrillas of the Peninsular War is an 18-card abstract take on the standard hex and counter wargame. Players will take on the role of either the French or the Spanish Guerrillas in reenacting the bloody insurgency that took place during the invasion and occupation of Spain from 1808 to 1814. The Guerrillas must do everything they can to protect their farms and villages from Napoleon’s forces, while the French must combat these insurgents in their mission to wrest control of much needed supplies.

—description from the designer
Families: Players: Wargames with Rules Supporting Only Two Players

Name: Seascrapers
Description:
A new city rises out of the seafloor. Pumice brick, ceramic and live coral form massive spiraling towers, bustling with the energy of thousands of beings. The merfolk have always lived a quiet agrarian life below the waves, but times are changing and the way forward is building up.

Seascrapers is a solitaire roll-and-write city-building game in which players attempt to develop an underwater metropolis. By rolling dice, players can build facilities to house builders(which allow for the rolling of additional dice), priests (which allow re-rolls of dice), and scholars (which allow for the creation of more advanced buildings). Players can also construct more specialized facilities, which can modify the effects of adjacent buildings or award points. The most lucrative points, however, come from buildings that scrape the very surface of the sea and emerge into the alien world above -- but these first require the development of vast infrastructure below.

Each turn, after dice are rolled and buildings are built, a space on the time track is crossed off. The end of this track represents the conclusion of the merfolk's efforts, and the city's score is tallied up for evaluation.

Can you balance the various classes of merfolk society to build towering seascrapers, or will your city end in a heap on the ocean floor?

—description from the publisher


Released in the June 2018 Board Game of the Month Club $5+ package.

Name: Grecia, Imperios del Pasado
Description:
Grecia Imperios del Pasado is a print and play strategy game of 2 to 4 players on Ancient Greece recreating scenarios such as the Trojan War or the expansion of Alexander the Great. It is based on units that go up in level to gain experience and the objective is to conquer the rival's strengths. The rules of the game are simple and the game is fast, so it works for non-insiders, but expert wargamers will like it too.

—description from the designer

Grecia Imperios del Pasado es un juego de estrategia sobre la Antigua Grecia recreando escenarios como la guerra de Troya o la expansión de Alejandro Magno. Se basa en unidades que van subiendo de nivel al adquirir experiencia y el objetivo consiste en conquistar las fortalezas del rival. Las reglas de juego son sencillas y el juego es rápido, así que sirve para no iniciados, pero a los wargamers expertos también les gustará.

—description from the designer (Spanish)

Name: Star Trek: Attack Wing – Mirror Universe Faction Pack: The Kelvin Timeline
Description: The Mirror Universe Faction Pack: The Kelvin Timeline is a pre-built fleet of four ships for the Mirror Universe faction: two Kelvin timeline Constitution class ships, and and two Kelvin timeline Klingon warbirds. Included are ships, tokens, dials, bases and 28 cards. Everything needed to fly the ships straight out of the box.

Name: Star Trek: Attack Wing – Independents Faction Pack: A Motley Fleet
Description: The Independent Faction Pack: A Motley Fleet is a pre-built fleet of four ships for the Independent faction: an Andorian battle cruiser, a Vidiian battle cruiser, a Maquis raider, and the U.S.S. Dauntless. Included are ships, tokens, dials, bases and 28 cards. Everything needed to fly the ships straight out of the box.

Name: Star Trek: Attack Wing – Hirogen Hunting Vessel Card Pack
Description:
The Hirogen Hunting Vessel is a Hirogen Warship class ship. As a card pack, it comes with all the cards and tokens required for play.

It is a part of card pack wave 4.

Name: Star Trek: Attack Wing – Fighter Squadrons 1 & 3 Card Pack
Description:
Fighter Squadrons 1 and 3 are Federation Attack Fighters. As a card pack, it comes with all the cards and tokens required for play.  Cards for both ships are included.

It is a part of card pack wave 4.

Name: Spellbook'd
Description:
Take on the role of an aspiring Wizard in an Academy of Magic.  Each Wizard is building up their skills to win an upcoming contest of their skills, judged by the Council of Archmages.  Study the different schools of magic, redeem your knowledge for Magems, and partake in a Spell Battle in your effort to become the victor of the contest!

Spellbook’d is a card drafting and dueling game involving three different game rounds to gather cards, spells, and points to win the game.  After the three different rounds of play the Wizard with the most Spell Points is declared the winner.

—description from the publisher

Name: Pub Battles: Gettysburg – Shall I Advance?
Description:
The Union desperately fights to stop Robert E Lee in this tense board game on the pivotal battle of the Civil War at Gettysburg.

Patterned and modeled on Kriegsspiel, this game is unprecedented in accuracy and realism in its portrayal of command.

Units realistically sprawl out in road column, resulting in delays, snaking and traffic snarls.  Baggage Trains add to the traffic and congestion problems. They have to be protected but also need to be kept close to the action to properly supply the troops.  Realistic, chaotic move sequence. Your troops don’t move when you want them to. You don’t know when exactly when your troops or the enemy will move. As the commander, you can only try to speed them up or slow them down. If that fails, you have to react quickly with contingency planning.  Realistic Fog of War: blocks hide exact unit strength and type. You can also hide your reserves off board. This forces players to realistically screen and probe. You can never be certain as to how close you are to breaking the enemy.

—description from the publisher

Name: The Courtship of the Flower Demons: A Romantic Supplement for Four Against Darkness
Description:
A Gorgeous Realm of Gardens and Alluring Maidens

The Blossoms' Demesne is a beautiful demonworld, rich in harvesting materials for brewing potions. Here, time is immaterial and wealth is won through love, not war. But its enigmatic ruler, the fay-like Blue-Haired Queen of Flowers, hides a terrible secret...
and many are the visitors who never want to come back.

The Courtship of the Flower Demons is both a game supplement and a solo adventure for Four Against Darkness, featuring:

     Over 110 magic potions and the recipes to craft them
     Complete rules for harvesting ingredients from monster organs
     New classes: the Alchemist, the Conservationist and the lustful Satyr
     A system that upgrades monsters based on your highest level character
     Wooing rules, a system for seduction with tactical options
     Two new mechanics, Melancholy and Mesmerizing
     A new, lovely but deadly pocket universe, ripe with mysteries to unearth
     Six encounter tables, with foes to be either fought or seduced
     New Blossoms spells, gifts and magic items
     Options for revisiting your usual games - such as wooing medusas and misdirecting gremlins!


—description from the publisher

Name: Nikimak
Description:
Chaos and destruction have overwhelmed every place and soon the entire planet will end up into the hands of criminals and outlaws. Everybody has only one hope: the future... (And a bit of luck!!)
To win, find your wisest and most skillful friends and repel the insidious and destructive insects from your headquarters.
Good luck commander...

A smart combination of strategy, mind-reading and risk-taking, inspired by the card game “Rat a Tat Cat” with a lot more tweaks in gameplay and 2 wooden dice!

At the beginning of the game, players have little information about their cards, but further on, this information is not only about their cards, but also about the opponents' cards!

—description from the publisher

Name: Codeword Thunderclap
Description:
Codeword Thunderclap (CTC) is a strategic-level two-player wargame of low-intermediate complexity that covers the climactic fighting in and near Stalingrad from November 1942 through March 1943. The game’s sub-systems are crafted to present a supreme-commander’s-eye-view: it is almost fully strategic in its perspective, with only the most pastel of operational undertones added to enhance historical tone and texture.

Each hex on the map represents 16 miles (26 km) from side to opposite side. Each full turn of play represents one-third of a month of ‘real time.’ Units of maneuver are corps and armies or their ad hoc emergency unit equivalents.

Command Magazine Japan #143 in October 2018.
